definition: broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: The shabby houses used to range along the road.
sentences.chinese: 過去這路邊破敗的房子排成行。

sentences.english: The building is now a ruin.
White houses prank where once were huts.
sentences.chinese: 一幢幢的房子傲然矗立在一度只是破敗陋室的地方。

sentences.english: The sprawling campus is pleasant enough but badly dilapidated.
sentences.chinese: 現在校園裏洋溢着吉慶，但面貌仍是極度破敗。

sentences.english: He went to the tattered screen door and knocked.
sentences.chinese: 他走上前去敲了敲那扇破敗的房門。

sentences.english: A dead tree stands to the right of a tumbledown brownstone house.
sentences.chinese: 在一座破敗的褐砂石房子的右側，矗立着一棵枯樹。

sentences.english: Pyongyang's harsh winter and shattered economy were obstacles too.
sentences.chinese: 平壤凌厲的寒冬以及破敗的經濟同樣成爲一大障礙。

sentences.english: The tram went a long way through the poor suburbs.
sentences.chinese: 電車走過一段長長的道路，穿過破敗的郊區。

sentences.english: Factional politics has failed utterly to deal with these problems.
sentences.chinese: 黨派政治在對這些問題的處理上已徹底破敗。

sentences.english: Find the crumbling building to the west of the main asylum gate.
sentences.chinese: 找到那個位於阿克漢姆主門西側的破敗建築。

sentences.english: I bought a run-down farm house and plan to fix it up.
sentences.chinese: 我買了一間破敗的農舍，打算整修整修。

sentences.english: And so to hot, humid Saigon itself, a place that manages to be modern and moribund at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 在西貢這個又熱又潮溼的地方，現代與破敗共存。

sentences.english: Devastation over the world, bloodred sky burning the humans below.
sentences.chinese: 破敗遍佈世界，猩紅的天空炙烤着下方的人類。

sentences.english: In this decadent city, living in a rattrap.
sentences.chinese: 這座頹廢的城市，生活在這破敗的陋室裏。

sentences.english: I like the fact that Naples is slightly crumbling.
sentences.chinese: 那不勒斯有一點點破敗的感覺，我很喜歡。

sentences.english: Mason was seated on the broken front steps.
sentences.chinese: 梅森正在前面破敗的石級上坐着。

definition: lit. windswept and battered by rain/to undergo hardship (idiom)
left to return to unchecked growth/overgrown/grown wild
to be cut off from the rest of the world (idiom)
to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
